Material used.Description: SF-TAP tagged LRRK2 variants were expressed in HEK293 cells and purified via SF-TAP tandem affinity purification.

Readout description.Result Description: LRRK2 G2019S shows a 3-4-fold increase in kinase activity towards MKK6 compared to wild-type LRRK2.
LRRK2 I2020T shows a slight but significant increase (1.5-fold) in kinase activity towards MKK6 compared to wild-type LRRK2.
LRRK2 R1441C shows no significant alteration in kinase activity towards MKK6 compared to wild-type LRRK2.

Technical replicates.Description: Each aliquot of LRRK2 was divided into three to four sub-aliquots prior to kinase assay.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 was used as a positive control for kinase activity comparison.

Basic negative control.Description: Kinase dead variant LRRK2 K1906M was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Analysis of variance (ANOVA) was used, with pair-wise comparison performed by Tukey's post-hoc test.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Phosphorylation levels equivalent to wild-type LRRK2 activity (set as 100%).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Phosphorylation levels significantly higher or lower than wild-type LRRK2 activity (e.g., >150% or <50%).

Material used.Description: Proteins from kinase assays using HEK293-derived LRRK2 variants were separated and blotted for analysis.

Readout description.Result Description: Western blot analysis confirmed increased phosphorylation of MKK substrates by LRRK2 G2019S.
Western blot analysis confirmed a slight increase in phosphorylation of MKK substrates by LRRK2 I2020T.
Western blot analysis showed no significant change in phosphorylation of MKK substrates by LRRK2 R1441C.

Basic negative control.Description: Kinase dead variants were used as negative controls in Western blot analysis.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Densitometric analysis was performed using Image Quant software.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Phosphorylation signal intensity equivalent to wild-type LRRK2.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Phosphorylation signal intensity significantly higher or lower than wild-type LRRK2.

Material used.Description: Structures of the LRRK2 kinase domain and PD-associated variants were modelled using the swiss-model server with TAB1 structure as a template.

Readout description.Result Description: Homology modelling revealed that the G2019S mutation causes a local perturbation in the backbone structure of the LRRK2 kinase domain, likely facilitating an active kinase conformation.
Homology modelling showed no predictable effect on the backbone conformation for the I2020T mutation.
Homology modelling was not specifically performed for the R1441C mutation in the context of kinase domain structure.

Biological replicates.Description: Not applicable for in silico analysis.

Technical replicates.Description: Not applicable for in silico analysis.

Basic positive control.Description: Not applicable for in silico analysis.

Basic negative control.Description: Not applicable for in silico analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Structural conformation similar to wild-type LRRK2 kinase domain.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant structural deviation from wild-type LRRK2 kinase domain.
